definition[0]: a game played especially in Britain on a special table covered in green cloth, in which two people use long sticks to hit coloured balls into holes at the sides and corners of the table
example[0]: They meet up every Friday to play snooker.
definition[1]: to make it impossible for someone to do what they want to do
example[1]: If the council refuses our planning application, weâ€™re snookered.
